title: Find Low Competition Amazon KDP Niches

tactics.name: Amazon Search Bar + Extensions
tactics.description: Use Amazon's autocomplete with AMZ Suggestion Expander and DS Amazon Quick View to identify niches with actual search demand.
steps: Install AMZ Suggestion Expander and DS Amazon Quick View extensions
Search Amazon's 'All Departments' for book types (notebooks, journals, etc.)
Analyze expanded search suggestions and BSR rankings
Filter niches with <1,000 search results and BSR <300,000
caveats: High BSR may indicate saturation even with low search volume
source_quotes: look for book niches with a thousand search results or less

tactics.name: BSR to Sales Estimation
tactics.description: Estimate monthly sales using BSR and a sales calculator tool
steps: Use Amazon Quick View extension to get BSR
Input BSR into TCK Publishing sales calculator
Analyze estimated monthly sales and profit margins
caveats: BSR over 300k may still be viable with low competition
source_quotes: the average book profit is two to three dollars

tactics.name: Review Count Filtering
tactics.description: Identify niches with low competition via review counts
steps: Filter products with 10 reviews or less
Prioritize niches with multiple low-review products
caveats: Ensure sufficient product listings exist for demand
source_quotes: make sure there's actual books that show up on the first page

heuristics.name: BSR Averaging Rule
heuristics.condition: If top 3 product BSR averages <300,000 then boost niche
source_quotes: average them out and look for an average bsr of 300 000 or less

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, boost niche viability
source_quotes: the more reviews that they have on the first page the harder it is to compete

claims.statement: BSR <300,000 correlates to ~16 monthly sales for Amazon books
source_quotes: equates to roughly 16 sales per month

claims.statement: Average book profit ranges from $2 to $3
source_quotes: the average book profit is two to three dollars

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific demographics with hobbies/jobs and contextual constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Limits competition while maintaining search demand
source_quotes: add a niche or hobby in front of our notebook

niche_patterns.example: teen boys + basketball notebook + low review count
niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with niche products that have minimal competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines targeted identity with low competition signals for higher success probability
source_quotes: we have three that have under 10 reviews
